channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A weakened Helene brings 'catastrophic' flooding as it crosses southern Appalachians
item.description: Helene, now a post-tropical cyclone, continues to flood parts of North Carolina and the Tennessee Valley. Dozens of storm-related deaths were reported in Florida, Georgia and the Carolinas.
item.content:encoded:
Helene, now a post-tropical cyclone, continues to flood parts of North Carolina and the Tennessee Valley. Dozens of storm-related deaths were reported in Florida, Georgia and the Carolinas.

(Image credit: Phelan M. Ebenhack)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Justice Department sues Alabama, claiming it purged voters too close to the election
item.description: In a new lawsuit, the Justice Department claims Alabama violated federal law by systematically removing voters fewer than 90 days before a federal election.
item.content:encoded:
In a new lawsuit, the Justice Department claims Alabama violated federal law by systematically removing voters fewer than 90 days before a federal election.

(Image credit: Butch Dill)
item.dc:creator: Hansi Lo Wang

item.title: At the border in Arizona, Harris lays out a plan to get tough on fentanyl
item.description: Vice President Harris is trying to shore up one of her biggest political liabilities. She focused her border security remarks on disrupting fentanyl smuggling.
item.content:encoded:
Vice President Harris is trying to shore up one of her biggest political liabilities. She focused her border security remarks on disrupting fentanyl smuggling.

(Image credit: Rebecca Noble)
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram

item.title: Something is Missing from London: Children
item.description: The Hackney area of East London is burgeoning with art galleries and cafes. But the neighborhood, like many places that are appealing to young professionals, is rapidly losing families with children. And some experts say it's a bad sign for the future. We go to Hackney to understand the problem.
item.content:encoded:
The Hackney area of East London is burgeoning with art galleries and cafes. But the neighborhood, like many places that are appealing to young professionals, is rapidly losing families with children. And some experts say it's a bad sign for the future. We go to Hackney to understand the problem.

(Image credit: Lauren Frayer)
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: Sean Combs accused of impregnating, threatening woman in new assault lawsuit
item.description: In the 12th lawsuit filed against the hip-hop mogul since last November, an unnamed victim alleges that Sean Combs coerced her into sex, impregnated her, then threatened her into silence.
item.content:encoded:
In the 12th lawsuit filed against the hip-hop mogul since last November, an unnamed victim alleges that Sean Combs coerced her into sex, impregnated her, then threatened her into silence.

(Image credit: Mike Coppola)
item.dc:creator: Sidney Madden

item.title: A new kind of drug for schizophrenia promises fewer side effects
item.description: A medicine that sidesteps the brain's dopamine receptors to reach different targets represents a new approach to schizophrenia treatment. The Food and Drug Administration approved it Thursday.
item.content:encoded:
A medicine that sidesteps the brain's dopamine receptors to reach different targets represents a new approach to schizophrenia treatment. The Food and Drug Administration approved it Thursday.

(Image credit: Steve Belkowitz)
item.dc:creator: Sydney Lupkin

item.title: Netanyahu defies calls for a cease-fire at the U.N., as Israel strikes Lebanon
item.description: In a fiery speech at the United Nations General Assembly, the Israeli prime minister said his country would is "winning" and would attack Iran and its proxies anywhere in the Middle East.
item.content:encoded:
In a fiery speech at the United Nations General Assembly, the Israeli prime minister said his country would is "winning" and would attack Iran and its proxies anywhere in the Middle East.

(Image credit: Pamela Smith)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: Supreme Court rejects RFK Jr's appeal to be put on the New York ballot
item.description: In New York major party candidates automatically appear on the ballot, but minor party candidates must collect 45,000 voter signatures by petition in order to qualify. Kennedy, who has withdrawn from the race and backed Donald Trump, gathered more than 100,000 valid signatures.
item.content:encoded:
In New York major party candidates automatically appear on the ballot, but minor party candidates must collect 45,000 voter signatures by petition in order to qualify. Kennedy, who has withdrawn from the race and backed Donald Trump, gathered more than 100,000 valid signatures.

(Image credit: Olivier Touron)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Auction for Shohei Ohtani's 50/50 ball goes live as fans fight over who owns it
item.description: An 18-year-old filed a lawsuit against another baseball fan after the two tussled over Ohtani's historic 50th homerun ball. Now, an online auction for the ball may add another fan into the mix.
item.content:encoded:
An 18-year-old filed a lawsuit against another baseball fan after the two tussled over Ohtani's historic 50th homerun ball. Now, an online auction for the ball may add another fan into the mix.

(Image credit: Marta Lavandier)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Bangladesh defies stereotypes when it comes to health care. Let's keep it that way
item.description: Bangladesh defies the stereotypes. It was born in poverty but has risen up the income ladder and is a model of health progress. Will the current political upheaval take a toll on its impressive achievements?
item.content:encoded:
Bangladesh defies the stereotypes. It was born in poverty but has risen up the income ladder and is a model of health progress. Will the current political upheaval take a toll on its impressive achievements?

(Image credit: Allison Joyce for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Junaid Nabi
